title: Afroj's Winter Weekly Meal Plan
overview: This personalized 7-day winter meal plan for Afroj, designed for a household of two, focuses on high-protein meals from Mediterranean, Asian, Mexican, and Indian cuisines. The plan incorporates intermediate-level recipes, utilizes Sunday for meal prep to simplify busy weeknights, and ensures all cooking times are under 45 minutes, with quick options for Tuesday and Thursday.

breakfast.name: High-Protein Scrambled Eggs with Spinach and Whole Wheat Toast

lunch.name: Leftover Sheet Pan Chicken Fajita Bowl (from Sunday prep)

dinner.name: Indian-Inspired Red Lentil Dal with Brown Rice and Roasted Broccoli

breakfast.name: Green Smoothie with Spinach, Banana, and Protein Powder

lunch.name: Leftover Red Lentil Dal (from Monday dinner)

dinner.name: Quick Shrimp and Veggie Stir-fry with Instant Brown Rice

breakfast.name: Oatmeal with Mixed Berries, Nuts, and Protein Powder

lunch.name: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad with Feta, Cucumber, Tomatoes, and Olives

dinner.name: Baked Salmon with Roasted Asparagus and Sweet Potato

breakfast.name: Breakfast Burrito with Scrambled Eggs, Bell Peppers, and Whole Wheat Tortilla

lunch.name: Leftover Baked Salmon with Asparagus and Sweet Potato (from Wednesday dinner)

dinner.name: Black Bean & Corn Quesadillas with Salsa and Greek Yogurt

breakfast.name: Greek Yogurt with Mixed Berries and Chia Seeds

lunch.name: Leftover Black Bean & Corn Quesadillas (from Thursday dinner)

dinner.name: Chicken Tikka Masala with Brown Rice and Naan Bread

breakfast.name: Whole Wheat Pancakes with Fresh Fruit and Greek Yogurt

lunch.name: Leftover Chicken Tikka Masala (from Friday dinner)

dinner.name: Asian Ground Turkey Lettuce Wraps with Peanut Dipping Sauce

breakfast.name: Greek Yogurt with Granola and Mixed Berries

lunch.name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad with Whole Wheat Pita

dinner.name: Sheet Pan Chicken Fajitas with Cilantro Lime Rice (Batch Cook for 2-3 future meals)

produce: Bell Peppers (red, green, yellow): 1 of each color
Lettuce (butter or iceberg for wraps): 1 head
protein: Greek Yogurt (plain, high protein): 1 large (32oz) tub
Protein Powder (whey or plant-based): 1 container (if not already stocked)
pantry: Whole Wheat Pita Bread: 1 package (6-8 pitas)
Brown Rice (long grain or instant): 1 (2lb) bag
Honey or Maple Syrup: 1 bottle (if not already stocked)
Olive Oil (assumed stocked, but for specific recipe needs)
Curry Paste (red or green): 1 small jar

prep_tips: Sunday: Batch cook extra chicken fajita components (chicken, peppers, onions) and cilantro lime rice. Store separately for Monday lunch and potential quick dinner later in the week.
Throughout the week: When chopping vegetables for dinner, chop extra for the next day's meal or snack to save time.
Hard boil a batch of 2-4 eggs on Sunday or Monday for quick high-protein snacks during the week.
Pre-portion nuts and berries for snacks or breakfast toppings.
personalization_notes: This plan caters specifically to Afroj's preferences by featuring a diverse range of Mediterranean, Asian, Mexican, and Indian cuisines. It prioritizes high-protein meals and incorporates meal-prep friendly recipes, especially on Sunday, to ensure busy weeknights (Tuesday and Thursday) have quick or leftover options. All recipes are at an intermediate skill level, respect the 45-minute cooking time limit, and are scaled for two people within a moderate budget, targeting approximately 1800 calories per day per person.
